workflow.name: Generate stock market insights with technical analysis, AI, and Telegram publishing
workflow.description:
# üìà AI Stock Analytics & BCS "Profit" Social Network Publishing Workflow  

This workflow automatically generates stock market insights for selected tickers (e.g. GAZP, SBER, LKOH) using historical data, technical indicators, and an AI model. The results are then sent to Telegram for quick moderation and publishing.  

## üîë What this workflow does
- **Runs twice a day** on a schedule with a predefined list of tickers.  
- **Fetches historical market data** from a broker API.  
- **Calculates key technical indicators** (RSI, EMA/SMA, MACD, Bollinger Bands, ADX).  
- **Generates an investment post** (title + summary) using an LLM.  
- **Stores results** in a PostgreSQL database.  
- **Sends a draft post to Telegram** with inline buttons *‚ÄúPublish‚Äù* and *‚ÄúRetry‚Äù*.  
- **Handles Telegram actions**: publishes the post to the final channel or re-runs the generation process.  

## üìå Key features
- Multi-ticker support in a single run.  
- Automatic error handling (e.g. missing data or invalid AI JSON output).  
- Human-in-the-loop moderation through Telegram before publishing.  
- PostgreSQL integration for history and analytics storage.  
- Flexible structure: easy to extend with new tickers, indicators, or publishing channels.  

## üõ†Ô∏è Nodes used
- **Trigger:** Schedule (twice daily) + Telegram Trigger (button callbacks).  
- **Data:** HTTP Request (broker API), Function (technical analysis calculations).  
- **AI:** OpenAI / OpenRouter with structured JSON output.  
- **Storage:** PostgreSQL (analytics history).  
- **Messaging:** Telegram (drafts and publishing).  

## üöÄ Who is this for
- Fintech startups looking to automate market content.  
- Investment bloggers posting daily stock analysis.  
- Analysts experimenting with trading strategies on real market data.

parameters.jsCode:
const ticker = $input.first().json.ticker
const classCode = $input.first().json.classCode
const title = $input.first().json.title
const text = $input.first().json.summary

const post = {
  title: title,
  content: `${text}\n#–¢–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ {$${ticker}}`,
  filesInfo: [],
  instruments: [{ securityCode: ticker, classCode: classCode }],
  profiles: [],
  tags: ['–¢–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑'],
  strategies: []
};

return [{ json: { post } }];

This workflow automatically generates stock market insights for selected tickers (e.g. GAZP, SBER, LKOH) using historical data, technical indicators, and an AI model. The results are then sent to Telegram for quick moderation and publishing.

- **Stores results** in a PostgreSQL database.  
- **Sends a draft post to Telegram** with inline buttons *‚ÄúPublish‚Äù* and *‚ÄúRetry‚Äù*.  
- **Handles Telegram actions**: publishes the post to the final channel or re-runs the generation process.

- PostgreSQL integration for history and analytics storage.

- **AI:** OpenAI / OpenRouter with structured JSON output.  
- **Storage:** PostgreSQL (analytics history).  
- **Messaging:** Telegram (drafts and publishing).  

## üöÄ Who is this for

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

data.details: The Crypto node allows you to hash and Hmac string in a specified format and sign a string using a private key. Use this node when you want to encrypt your data.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
